intro: Gomphocarpus viridiflorus, commonly known as the greenflower milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by follicles containing the toxic, milky sap. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. The plant is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
